Class LabeledSoundFiles

extends Object
    Helper class to manage sounds and associated metadata files.
    TODO: some of this function should be moved to MetaData class.
    Author:
    dawood

      • loadMetaDataSounds

        public static ISoundDataSet loadMetaDataSounds(String[] src,
                                               boolean requireAllFiles)
                                        throws IOException
        Read sounds from 1 or more metadata files.
        Parameters:
        src - list containing names of directories with metadata.csv files and/or metadata.csv files.
        requireAllFiles - if true, then throw an exception if the files referenced in the metadata file were not found in the given directory. Otherwise, just ignore any missing files.
        Returns:
        never null.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • loadMetaDataSounds

        public static ISoundDataSet loadMetaDataSounds(String src,
                                               boolean requireAllFiles)
                                        throws IOException
        Load sounds listed in the file and found in the given directory. File formats supports are those supported by LabeledSoundFileIterable (at least mp3 and wav).
        Parameters:
        src - the name of a file with the '.csv' extension containing meta data about sounds or a directory containing the file.
        requireAllFiles - if true, then throw an exception if the files referenced in the metadata file were not found at the location specified in the metadata file.. Otherwise, just ignore any missing files.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        IOException - if metadata file can not be found.

      • loadSounds

        public static ISoundDataSet loadSounds(String srcDir,
                                       boolean requireMetaData)
                                throws IOException
        Load sound files in the given directory and optionally metadata from in that directory. If a metadata file is present, then only load sound files referenced and don't require all listed to be present. If a metadata file is not present, then load all files in the directory, but all will have no labels. File formats supported are those supported by LabeledSoundFileIterable (at least mp3 and wav), which ultimately uses MetaData.readSound(String) which adds the tag MetaData.FILENAME_TAG.
        Parameters:
        srcDir - directory containing sounds and optionally a metadata.csv file.
        requireMetaData - if true then throw an exception if the metadata.csv file is not found in the given directory.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        IOException
        See Also:
        MetaData}

      • writeMetaDataSounds

        public static List<String> writeMetaDataSounds(String dest,
                                               Iterable<SoundRecording> sounds,
                                               Iterable<String> names)
                                        throws IOException
        Write the given sounds and associated metadata file to the given directory. Sounds are written as WAV files with .wav extension. The names of the sounds are integer indexes, for example, 000001.wav unless names are provided.
        Parameters:
        dest - a directory or the name of a metadata file with a .csv extension. If the latter sounds are written to the directory specified.
        sounds -
        names - names to be used to store the corresponding sounds. If null, empty or smaller than the iterable of sounds, then an incremented index is used to name the files. The iterable may contain null values in which case the corresponding sound will be saved in an indexed file name.
        Returns:
        never null. the names of the sound files as written to the destination directory.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • deleteSounds

        public static void deleteSounds(String location)
                         throws IOException
        Delete the sounds specified by a metadata file indicated by the location parameter.
        Parameters:
        location - a directory containing file or the name of a metadata file.
